jobs.title: Senior Full stack Developer
jobs.description:
Are you a talented Senior Developer looking for a remote job that lets you show your skills and get decent compensation? Look no further than Lemon.io â the marketplace that connects you with hand-picked startups in the US and Europe.

What we offer:

  • The rate depends on your LOCATION, SENIORITY LEVEL, SKILLS and EXPERIENCE. We've already paid out over $11M to our engineers.
  • No more hunting for clients or negotiating rates â let us handle the business side of things so you can focus on what you do best.
  • We'll manually find the best project for you according to your skills and preferences.
  • Choose a schedule that works best for you. Itâs possible to communicate async or minimally overlap within team working hours.
  • We respect your seniority so you can expect no micromanagement or screen trackers.
  • Communicate directly with the clients. Most of them have technical backgrounds. Sounds good, yeah?
  • We will support you from the time you submit the application throughout all cooperation stages.
  • Most of our projects involve working in a fast-paced startup environment. We hope you like it as much as we do.
  • Through our community, we will connect you with the best developers from more than 50 countries.

Currently we have different Senior positions for Full-stack Developers: React & Ruby and Ruby & Node, React & Python.

Requirements - Senior React & Ruby:

  • 5+ years of software development experience
  • 3+ years of commercial experience with React.js and Ruby and Ruby on Rails

Requirements - Senior Ruby & Node (GMT -5:00) Eastern Time (US & Canada), BogotÃ¡, Lima, or other timezones with at least 4 hours of overlap per day:

  • 7+ years of experience with Ruby and Ruby on Rails
  • 5+ years of experience with Node.js
  • 2+ years of experience working for SaaS companies is a strong plus
  • Experience working with relational databases, particularly PostgreSQL
  • Understanding of RESTful API design and development
  • Exposure to Typescript in a development environment
  • Knowledge of MongoDB or other NoSQL databases
  • Ability and motivation to quickly learn new tools, technologies, and systems
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail

Requirements Senior React & Python:

  • 4+ years of software development experience.
  • 3+ years of commercial experience with React.js and Python.
  • 3+ years of experience with AWS, Django and TypeScript is a must.


Other Requirements:

  • Strong technical skills: as a Senior Developer, you are expected to be able to create projects from scratch and have a deep understanding of application architecture.
  • Clear and effective communication in English â advanced ability to discuss business tasks, justify decisions, and communicate issues. Good self-presentation is also essential for upcoming client calls.
  • Strong self-organizational skills â ability to work full-time remotely with no supervision.
  • Reliability â we want to trust you and expect that you wonât let us and the client down.
  • Adaptability and Flexibility â the ability to onboard the project promptly after accepting it and start delivering results quickly.

Sounds good for you? Apply now and join the Lemon.io community!

NOT YOUR TECH STACK?

We have different projects for Senior Full-Stack Developers, so if you have 4+ years of commercial experience in software development and you are fluent with AI Engineering, Python & LLM & AWS/GCP/Azure, UI/UX & Figma, Blockchain: Web3, Wordpress & Figma, Shopify & JavaScript, we would be happy to communicate and provide you with a project that matches your experience. Just apply, and we will share more details with you.

If your experience matches our requirements, be ready for the next steps:

  • VideoAsk â watch a short video about our startup, up to 10 minutes
  • Complete your profile on our website
  • 30-minute screening call
  • Technical interview
  • Feedback
  • Magic Box (we are looking for the best project for you).

P.S. We work with developers from 50+ countries in different regions: Europe, LATAM, the U.S., Canada, Asia (Philippines, Indonesia), Oceania (Australia, New Zealand, Papua New Guinea), and the the UK. However, we have some exceptions.

At the moment, we donât have a legal basis to accept applicants from the following countries:

  • European: Iceland, Liechtenstein, Kosovo, Belarus, Russia, and Serbia.
  • Latin America: Cuba and Nicaragua
  • Most Asian countries and Africa.

We expand and shorten the list of exemptions regularly.

We do not provide visa assistance, and our cooperation model does not include the benefits typically offered with direct hire.

Do you represent a company with engineers who match the description and want to collaborate with us through staff augmentation? Then register here.

jobs.title: Software Engineer Backend Fullstack
jobs.description:
About Sei

Sei Labs builds open sourced technology for the high-performance Sei Blockchain, the first parallelized EVM Layer 1 blockchain designed to scale with the industry. The unique optimizations built into Sei enable Web3 applications to reach Web2 level scale and performance, driving the mass adoption of digital assets.


Our teams are comprised of former Google, Goldman Sachs, Robinhood, Nvidia, and Databricks veterans dedicated to onboarding the next billion users onto a vibrant ecosystem of applications.


Sei Labs has raised over $30M from top investors including Jump Crypto, Multicoin Capital, Coinbase Ventures, Distributed Global, Hudson River Trading, and Flow Traders.


We're a globally distributed team with a fully remote workforce. Check out our website and docs for more details.


Fullstack Engineering at Sei

Sei Labs is looking for a Fullstack Engineer to help shape the future of Web3 by empowering innovative, high-impact applications across the Sei Blockchain. You'll work with a team at the forefront of blockchain technology, collaborating closely with our ecosystem partners to develop cutting-edge dApps spanning diverse Web3 domains (from DEXâs and games, to DePin, AI and beyond). If you're passionate about constant learning, rapid development, and making a tangible impact in a fast-paced, community-first environment, this is a unique opportunity to push the boundaries of what's possible in decentralized technology.

\n


Requirements
  • 3+ years of experience with full-stack development, with a focus on frontend
  • Proficiency with one of JavaScript, TypeScript, Node.js
  • Web3 experience & smart contract experience is a nice to have
  • Experience with database management using SQL, NoSQL, or similar technologies
  • Experience with cloud technologies such as AWS, Terraform


Responsibilities
  • Code/Manage Sei web2 backends (indexers, backend APIs, etc).
  • Code/Manage Sei frontends (website, governance platform, foundation website page, etc).

#LI-CG1


\n

jobs.title: Frontend Software Engineer
jobs.description:
About Bitwise

Bitwise is a leading crypto asset manager, overseeing $12B in client assets through a diverse range of investment solutions, including ETFs, separately managed accounts, private funds, staking solutions, and hedge fund strategies. Trusted by thousands of financial advisors, family offices, and institutional investors, we empower our partners to navigate and seize opportunities in the crypto market.


Recently, we raised a $70M funding round reinforcing our position as profitable, innovative leaders in digital assets. We're backed by top-tier investors like Electric Capital, MassMutual, Highland Capital, MIT Investment Management Company, Haun Ventures, ParaFi Capital, etc.


We're deeply committed to the crypto ecosystem, donating 10% of gross profits from our Bitcoin ETF (BITB) and Ethereum ETF (ETHW) to support open-source software developmentâcontributing over $250,000 last year alone to organizations like Brink, OpenSats, Protocol Guild, and PBS Foundation.


Our lean engineering team is at the heart of our success, building cutting-edge solutions that drive critical company functions. You'll work closely with key stakeholders in a collaborative, high-impact environment where autonomy and adaptability are key.


At Bitwise, engineers are empowered to act as their own product managers, setting priorities, defining timelines, and delivering impactful solutions that push our business forward. Join us to shape the future of finance with code that matters.


What You'll Do:
  • Craft delightful production experiences. Collaborate with marketing & engineering teams to build polished user interfaces with exceptional code quality and performance. You'll transform designs into pixel-perfect implementations with attention to every interaction detail.
  • Evolve our frontend architecture. Take ownership of our React/Next.js and TypeScript codebase, ensuring it remains maintainable, scalable, and performant. You'll implement best practices and architectural patterns that help our systems grow with the business.
  • Lead critical frontend migrations. Spearhead the transition from Next Pages router to App router, establishing patterns and practices while ensuring minimal disruption. You'll create a roadmap and execute the migration that modernizes our application architecture.
  • Enable global product reach. Introduce localization and multi-country support to our Expert Portal, making it accessible for our European team. You'll implement internationalization best practices while maintaining a consistent user experience.
  • Build new crypto experiences. Help develop a new staking application frontend for Bitwise Onchain, applying your frontend expertise to create intuitive interfaces for complex financial operations.
  • Drive engineering excellence. Continuously improve our processes, tools, and systems to scale both our codebase and team productivity. You'll participate in code reviews and help establish quality standards across the organization.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders. Work closely with business teams to translate requirements into reliable, scalable frontend solutions. You'll own projects end-to-end while aligning stakeholders to common goals and driving to finished outputs.


What We're Looking For:
  • 3+ years of React/Next.js and TypeScript frontend development experience
  • Portfolio demonstrating UI and engineering work
  • Familiarity with CSS styling approaches (css-in-js and Tailwind)
  • Knowledge of design patterns and common UX flows
  • Experience with headless CMS platforms and REST APIs
  • Fast-moving with a bias for impact and willingness to advocate for your work
  • Strong sense of ownership and ability to lead projects while aligning stakeholders
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills
  • Interest in learning about crypto and investments
  • (Plus) Understanding of design principles and experience with design tools like Figma 
  • (Plus) Experience with monorepo structures like Turborepo
  • (Plus) Familiarity with analytics tools (GA4, Mixpanel) and data-driven validation
  • (Plus) Bachelorâs degree in Computer Science or equivalent


What We Offer:
  • Competitive salary
  • Eligible for equity
  • Health, dental, vision insurance
  • 401K plan (company funded, no match required)
  • Unlimited PTO plus 10 paid holidays
  • Meals/snacks in office
  • Paid cell phone or stipend
  • Bitwise "Buddy" Program (30 day onboarding)
  • Annual birthday/anniversary gifts
  • Company wide events


$150,000 - $170,000 a year
Equity compensation as a component of all offers

Bitwise is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a team of people with a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. It is the policy of Bitwise to ensure equal opportunity. All candidates are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics.

jobs.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
jobs.description:
âOverviewâ

Daisychain is excited to announce the opening for a Software Engineer to join our team. This individual will be a part of our small, innovative team that is giving progressive community organizers new ways to bring data about their supporters together, orchestrate outreach, and automate busy-work â while scaling the impact they have in the world.Â Â 

Weâre seeking a software engineer who is excited about using their talents to deepen the impact of the causes we work with while having an opportunity to shape the technical direction of our product.

âDaisychain is building a modern platform for effective organizing. Our customers include progressive political campaigns, grassroots organizations, and ambitious non-profits. Collectively, they're using Daisychain to win critical campaigns, build powerful movements, and create a more just and equitable world.Â 

âJob Title:Â Software Engineer

âReports to:Â CTO

Schedule:Â Full-Time

âLocation:Â We're building a remote product and engineering team with a center of gravity in the New York City metro area. Work from anywhere with high speed internet as long as your work day overlaps with the U.S. East Coast business hours, so we can talk on Zoom and Slack. For candidates outside of the NYC metro area, this role requires travel to a team gathering 1-2 times per year.

âResponsibilities

  • âÂ Work collaboratively to deliver new features of the Daisychain product to customers.

  • Take part in planning new features, understanding high-level customer requirements, and shaping the vision for the Daisychain product.

  • Participate in peer code review, technical planning and architectural decision making.

âExperience Requirements

  • At least 3 years of experience writing ambitious full-stack software for the web.

  • Experience with a modern javascript framework like React or Vue.js

  • Experience with a model-view-controller web framework like Express.js, Django or Rails.

  • Experience with or openness to working remotely as part of a collaborative team.

  • Familiarity and experience with the ways that organizations and campaigns use the internet to create social change and organize people.

  • A passion for positive and progressive social change.

  • Fluent in written and spoken English

âPreferred Qualifications

  • Experience with AI/ML techniques.

  • Experience with voter files and other technologies that make up the political technology ecosystem.

  • Experience with column oriented databases or large scale data integration.

Technical Background

Our tech stack includes Ruby, Vue.js, Typescript, Clickhouse and Postgres, deployed on AWS. We are passionate about software engineering as a craft.Â  Daisychain is built on a solid foundation of best practices like continuous delivery, acceptance tests, monitoring and code review.

Compensation and Benefits

âWeâre considering both full-time salaried roles for candidates within the United States and contractor roles for candidates based outside of the United States.

  • The salary range for this position for full-time US Candidates is $120k - $160k depending on experience. The contractor compensation range for this position is dependent on location and experience.

  • Profit Sharing: Full-time employees are eligable to participate in Daisychain's profit-sharing program, aligning with our commitment to sharing the financial rewards of our collective efforts.

  • Â Benefits: Daisychain offers a comprehensive benefits package to full-time employees, including medical, dental, vision, matching 401(k), and paid time off.

âDaisychain is an Equal Opportunity Employer

We believe that diversity of ideas and perspectives makes our products and the movements that we serve stronger. We are proud to be an inclusive and equal-opportunity workplace, where all applicants and employees are considered for hire, promotion and job status without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religious affiliation, national origin, age, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or physical handicap.

jobs.title: Full Stack .NET Developer
jobs.description:
About Smart Working


At Smart Working, we believe your job should feel right â not just look right on paper. This isnât just another remote role. This is belonging remotely â and thatâs a big difference. From day one, you're supported, valued, and part of a genuine community. We're proud to be one of the highest-rated companies on Glassdoor India.


With one vision in mind â âGeographical limitations should not dictate access to talentâ â Smart Working helps great people build long-term, full-time remote careers with exceptional UK teams. Weâve created a culture where you're backed from day one and given the space to grow â personally and professionally.


About the Role


Weâre hiring a Full Stack Developer for a UK-based company specializing in underground services and subsidence investigations for the insurance industry. Youâll be part of a close-knit internal technology team, enhancing existing .NET applications, building new features, and contributing to cross-platform tools using Blazor, .NET MAUI, and modern front-end technologies.


This is a permanent, full-time, remote roleâideal for someone who thrives in a hands-on environment, communicates proactively, and enjoys working across a modern, Microsoft-based technology stack.

\n


What Youâll Be Doing
  • Working on both front-end user interfaces and server-side logic, including integration with web APIs.
  • Enhancing and maintaining internal .NET applications used across the business.
  • Developing new features using technologies like .NET, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Blazor.
  • Contributing to cross-platform development using .NET MAUI.
  • Supporting bug fixes and technical enhancements across the stack.
  • Communicating progress and updates via Jira, and collaborating with team members through Microsoft Teams.
  • Writing clean, well-documented code and participating in peer reviews to uphold quality and consistency.


Must-Have Skills
  • .NET (3â5 years)
  • .NET Blazor (at least 1 year)
  • HTML, CSS, JavaScript (3â5 years)
  • GitHub (minimum 1 year)
  • Experience working on both front-end and back-end development (50/50 split)
  • Experience integrating and working with APIs
  • Task management using Jira


Nice-to-Have Skills
  • .NET MAUI (1 year)
  • Azure DevOps (1 year)
  • Visual Studio
  • Experience building cross-platform applications


What Sets You Apart
  • Youâre naturally curious and proactive â you ask questions to better understand systems and arenât afraid to speak up or share feedback.
  • Youâre punctual â available during working hours and show up on time for meetings and scheduled discussions.
  • You communicate clearly and consistently â whether itâs updating tickets on Jira or responding to messages on Teams, you're present, responsive, and engaged.


Why Smart Workers Love It Here
  • Fixed Shifts â 12:00 PM â 9:30 PM IST (Summer) | 1:00 PM â 10:30 PM IST (Winter).
  • No Weekend Work â Real work-life balance, not just words.
  • Day 1 Benefits â Laptop and full medical insurance provided.
  • Support That Matters â Mentorship, community, and forums where ideas are shared.
  • True Belonging â A long-term home where your contributions are valued.


\n

At Smart Working, youâll never be just another remote hire.


Be a Smart Worker â valued, empowered, and part of a culture that celebrates integrity, excellence, and ambition.


If that sounds like your kind of place, weâd love to hear your story. ð§¡

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
jobs.description:
ð Join Our Mission https://www.elevateab.com

We are looking for talented engineers based in North Africa, the Middle East, or South America this position is only for candidates in these regions.

YOU MUST INCLUDE YOUR LINKEDIN IN YOUR APPLICATION IF YOU WANT TO BE INTERVIEWED

UPDATE: June 5th still looking for 3 Senior Engineers

Elevate is reshaping the future of e-commerce optimization through innovative A/B testing solutions. We're helping Shopify stores unlock higher conversions and revenue by providing actionable insights and growth strategies to some of the world's leading e-commerce brands.

This isn't just another development role â you'll be a key team member building the platform that directly impacts thousands of merchants and millions of shoppers, driving real revenue growth through better optimization tools.

ð¡ The Opportunity

We have a thriving A/B testing platform that's already helping e-commerce merchants optimize their stores for better conversions. Our foundation is strong, but we're scaling rapidly and need experienced engineers to help us build the next generation of our platform.


As our Senior Fullstack Developer, you'll architect and build critical features across our entire stack, working on both the user-facing experiences that merchants love and the robust backend systems that power our analytics and testing infrastructure.

ð ï¸ What We've Built So Far

Modern A/B testing platform serving leading e-commerce brands
React and Next.js frontend with intuitive user interfaces
Scalable backend APIs and services
ClickHouse database handling massive volumes of user interaction data
Comprehensive analytics and reporting systems

ð¤ AI-Powered Development
We expect our engineers to leverage AI tools to accelerate development and maintain high productivity:

  • Experience with AI coding tools - You should be proficient with Cursor, Claude, ChatGPT, and Devin for development work
  • AI-assisted coding - Ability to use these tools effectively for code generation, debugging, and problem-solving


This isn't optional - we rely on these tools to move quickly while maintaining quality, so experience using AI for development is essential for success in this role.

ð Who We're Looking For
You're not just a developer â you're a builder, problem-solver, and scaling expert with:

5+ years of professional software development experience
Strong expertise in React and modern JavaScript/TypeScript
Proven experience with Next.js framework (SSR, SSG, API routes)
Proficiency in backend development (Node.js)
Experience with RESTful APIs and GraphQL
Knowledge of database design SQL and (ClickHouse experience a plus)

ð The Ideal Candidate
You thrive in environments where you can:

Transform complex requirements into elegant, scalable solutions
Move fast while building for long-term maintainability
Work collaboratively with product, design, and engineering teams
Take ownership of features from conception to deployment

ð® What Happens Next
Our interview process is straightforward and focused:

Initial conversation about your background and our technical vision
Technical interview exploring your experience and problem-solving approach

ð¼ The Opportunity

Key team member with significant impact on product direction
Remote-friendly with flexible hours
Work with modern technologies and best practices
Be part of a fast-growing company with massive potential

Preferred Qualifications:

Shopify development experience (Liquid, Shopify APIs, app development)
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS)
Experience with state management libraries (Redux, Zustand, etc.)
Experience with Shopify

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer
jobs.description:
MediaLab is a media & technology company focused on acquiring and growing properties and global brands. The organization is a unique combination of private equity, holding company and operating entity. We continue to expand and are proud of the prominent market position of our brands.  


Come join an exceptionally talented team of engineers, designers, product and business builders. HQ is located in sunny Santa Monica, California with growing teams in New York, and across cities in the US and Latin America.


Genius is looking for a remote Full-stack Engineer to help build the ultimate music companion, enabling fans to collaboratively transcribe lyrics and write annotations that live on Genius.com and everywhere people experience music. Weâre looking for makers with a sophisticated code sense: folks whoâve built cool things, but who can also maintain and scale those things, and who feel at home deep in the guts of a library.


As a Full-stack Engineer for Genius, you will play a key role in building the website, helping us deliver on the next generation of product features. You will work across our frontend and backend to delight our users, improve site performance, and increase user retention, ensuring the success of the Genius business. Additionally, youâll work to improve the stability, reliability and security posture of Geniusâ services, which is no small feat for a website serving millions of users daily!

\n


What You'll Do
  • Build and ship high-quality site features, working with a Rails backend and a React front-end
  • Proactively identify and fix infrastructure bottlenecks to scale backend services to tens of thousands of requests per minute
  • Work with product design team to build rich, intuitive user experiences in the browser
  • Architect database query patterns and migrations that scale to large tables with 1B+ rows
  • Take ownership over the features you build, proactively identifying and surfacing UX, performance and maintainability improvements
  • During your on-call rotation, be the backstop for site quality, stability, and performance. Triage incoming issues to find the most urgent problems, and handle emergent incidents to keep the site online.
  • Work directly with stakeholders to uncover and address business needs, including product owners, designers and other engineers across the company


What We're Searching For
  • Proficiency with a âbatteries-includedâ backend framework like Ruby on Rails (or similar). Candidates should be comfortable working with large, established codebases, and have an understanding of architectural patterns necessary to build APIs at scale
  • Experience building user-friendly interfaces using a modern, component-based front-end framework (React, Vue, Angular, etc). including proficiency in state management, end-to-end testing, and CSS-in-JS.
  • Proficiency with SQL and relational databases. Candidates should be able to design database schemas, write complex queries, and optimize performance for scale
  • Product Ownership: Brings a product-first mindset, able to drive projects from ideation to launch while focusing on user needs, business impact, and cross-functional alignment.
  • Collaboration & Communication: Comfortable working cross-functionally with design, product, and other engineering teams to ensure clarity, alignment, and smooth execution of projects.
  • Continuous Learning: Demonstrates a passion for staying current with new technologies, frameworks, and industry best practicesâproactively applying improvements to code quality and team workflows.
  • Experience: At least 2 years of hands-on experience in a technical engineering capacity, preferably in a fast-paced or product-driven environment.
  • Education (Preferred): Bachelorâs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field.


\n

At MediaLab, we rely on a range of backgrounds, experiences, and ideas. We value diversity, and weâre proud to be an inclusive, equal opportunity workplace.

jobs.title: Staff Frontend Engineer
jobs.description:
About Notabene


Working across three continents in eight countries, Notabene is a remote-first and globally distributed team of 40 employees on a mission to make cryptocurrency a part of the everyday economy. As a regulation technology (reg-tech) company, crypto organizations and traditional financial institutions alike use our tools to reduce transaction risk and make crypto transfers safe. Notabene is recognized as a vital enabler of the crypto ecosystem and, to date, weâve processed over half a trillion dollars worth of transactions!


In October 2024, we announced our $14.5M Series B, led by DRW. This fundraise signals our exciting trajectory of success as we continue to be the leading global platform and network for compliant crypto transactions. We're proud to have the support of Y Combinator, Jump Capital, Castle Island, Green Visor Capital, and more. Notabene is growing fastâand weâre looking for people like you to play a pivotal role in shaping the future infrastructure of the crypto industry.


The Impact You'll Have

As a Staff Engineer at Notabene, you'll be a pivotal force driving the development of our complex, distributed payment systems that move hundreds of billions of dollars globally. You will lead by example as a top-tier individual contributor, shaping technical direction while collaborating closely with cross-functional teams. Your ability to take initiative, navigate ambiguity, and deliver high-quality code across the stack will directly impact the scalability and reliability of our platform. This role offers significant autonomy and the opportunity to influence the future infrastructure of compliant crypto transactions worldwide.


\n


What You'll Do
  • Lead the design and development of scalable front-end and full-stack solutions with a focus on maintainability and performance.
  • Collaborate closely with product, design, and engineering teams to define technical requirements and deliver high-quality features.
  • Own and drive complex projects from concept to deployment, ensuring alignment with business goals and technical standards.
  • Mentor and coach junior engineers, providing constructive code reviews and fostering a culture of continuous learning.
  • Contribute to the evolution of our engineering practices, tooling, and architecture to support rapid growth and innovation.
  • Participate in live coding and system design sessions to solve challenging problems and improve system reliability.


Must-Have Qualifications
  • 4+ years of professional software engineering experience, preferably with a focus on front-end development and full-stack capabilities
  • Proven ability to lead projects and collaborate cross-functionally, demonstrating strong communication and mentorship skills
  • Experience working in fast-paced, high-autonomy environments where initiative and self-motivation are essential
  • Solid understanding of TypeScript and modern web frameworks; ability to quickly learn new technologies such as SvelteKit
  • Demonstrated track record of delivering complex software solutions from concept to production, with attention to detail and quality
  • Experience in FinTech, crypto, or related domains is highly desirable but not mandatory, with a willingness to quickly learn the space
  • Comfortable working in a meritocratic, results-driven culture that values flow state productivity and ownership of outcomes


Nice to Have
  • Experience in FinTech or blockchain sectors, especially with front-end technologies
  • Prior exposure to financial institutions and AML compliance processes
  • Proficiency in TypeScript and familiarity with modern front-end frameworks like SvelteKit or React
  • Understanding of privacy and security standards (SOC2, ISO27001, GDPR)
  • Experience working in fast-paced, autonomous environments with a focus on delivering high-quality code across the full stack
  • Demonstrated ability to mentor and coach junior engineers
  • Knowledge of distributed systems and complex payment infrastructures
  • Entrepreneurial mindset with experience building projects or products from concept to deployment


Benefits
  • Flexible Remote Work: Work from anywhere!
  • $1000 WFH Stipend: Use within your first year of employment.
  • MacBook Pro: Procured by you and your manager to find a model that meets your needs.
  • Unlimited PTO: We trust you to take as much holiday as you need.
  • Country-Specific Benefits: Statutory offerings and contributions, managed via our employer-of-record.


\n

Apply Today!


If you strongly believe this role is for you, please apply. Notabene considers a broad array of candidates, including those without blockchain experience. Whether youâre returning to work after a gap in employment, or taking the next step in your career path, we will be glad to have you on our radar.


Notabene is proud to be an equal employment workplace and an affirmative action employer. By valuing inclusion and diversity of all forms, we strictly prohibit and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, ancestry, citizenship, sexual orientation, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected characteristic.

jobs.title: Developer Productivity Engineer
jobs.description:
Developer Productivity Engineers (DPE) at Nx help engineering teams deliver faster by guiding them through Nx adoption, setting up Nx Cloud, establishing best practices, and optimizing their CI/CD. Simply put, DPEs are responsible for our customers' success.



What youâll do


Sales Support

Support the sales cycle including participating in introductory calls with prospective customers. Youâll lead trials of Nx Cloud improving customers CI times while helping our sales team build a business case.


â¢ Attend introductory sales calls and answer technical questions

â¢ Give product demos/workshops

â¢ Lead trials of Nx Cloud

â¢ Identify customer goals and success metrics

â¢ Capture before and after metrics

â¢ Communicate with engineers and senior management

â¢ Support during the procurement process



Customer Success

Build strong relationships with customers while helping them take full advantage of Nx and Nx Cloud, ultimately improving their DX and CI times.


Lead the product onboarding phase, setting up Nx Cloud and completing workspace and CI/CD reviews. Youâll create annual plans for customers and check-in with them monthly helping them make progress and remove obstacles.


â¢ Lead new customer onboarding efforts

â¢ Build strong relationships with customer stakeholders

â¢ Provide training as needed

â¢ Create annual plans with and for our customers

â¢ Lead customer check-ins

â¢ Lead annual reviews

â¢ Identify opportunities for account expansion

â¢ Work closely with Nx account managers on renewal and expansion efforts

â¢ Lead demos/workshops with new teams


*Occasional travel to visit customers and to attend industry events.


Key outcomes of this position are account retention, account expansion, and customer satisfaction.

\n


\n

jobs.title: Graphic Designer Fully Position
jobs.description:
Meeting Tomorrow is a full-service events agency dedicated to creating unparalleled experiences for both our clients and our team. Weâre a growing team of 95 employees, leading the way in building a supportive remote work environment where culture, collaboration, and well-being come first. Our clients range from Fortune 500 companies to small businesses and everything in between, and we plan and produce events across the country and globally with precision and care. With 20 years of experience and a people-first mission, our team brings creativity, expertise, and kindness to every interaction. If youâre looking for a role where you can contribute to meaningful projects, enjoy the flexibility of 100% remote work, and grow alongside a team that truly values you, weâd love to hear from you!


$64,040 - $80,000 a year
The above is the starting salary for this position. Where someone starts within the range is based on applicable experience to the role and is gleaned through the interview process.

The Opportunity 
This 100% remote Graphic Designer position is a rare opportunity to strategically shape the entire visual identity of our clientsâ events. Youâll apply your multi-disciplinary experience to a wide range of companies and event types, translating our clientsâ brand guidelines into creative and compelling visuals across all physical and digital areas of their events. Your expertise in typography, color, and layout will breathe life into scenic, print, digital, and motion designs, ensuring every element resonates with their brand and audience.

Youâll work alongside 3 other dynamic creatives in our Creative Services department as well as a cadre of graphic design freelancers. Youâll also collaborate with our sales, technical production, vendor network, and project management teams. Most of your day will be spent researching, brainstorming, and designing. Youâll regularly be working on conceptual designs, 2D files, producing assets, and preparing artwork for production.

We are looking for someone who is passionate about design, and loves the idea of elevating our clientsâ brands through powerful concepts and visuals  â who aims to make our clients say âWowâ every time through their creativity and vision.

Main Responsibilities Include
â¢ Elevate Event Branding: Develop compelling logos, themes, and visual elements that align with client objectives and brand identity, driving impactful event experiences.
â¢ Create Engaging Content: Design a wide range of 2D and motion graphics, including presentation templates, signage, digital assets, and print collateral, ensuring consistent brand application.
â¢ Ensure Brand Consistency: Interpret and apply brand guidelines across all deliverables, maintaining a cohesive visual identity for clients and internal projects.
â¢ Collaborate and Support: Partner with clients' marketing teams, sales, and internal departments to deliver exceptional design solutions and provide essential creative support.
â¢ Stay Ahead of Design Trends: Conduct ongoing research to incorporate modern and innovative design practices into all projects.

Who You Are
The right person for this role is creative with strong communication skills, attention to detail, a problem-solving mindset, and the ability to effectively collaborate with internal teams and clients to execute high-quality designs.

Additionally, weâre looking for -

â¢ Values: You exhibit our company core values of Kindness, Commitment, and Humility.
â¢ 5+ years of experience: We work with a wide range of clients and requests, so itâs a must that you have previous experience working with multiple brands and creating print, digital, motion graphics, small-format designs, and large-format design.
â¢ Software knowledge: This is a multi-disciplinary role, so you need to be proficient with Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign), Motion Graphics, PowerPoint, Keynote, and Google Suite regularly. Bonus points if you have experience with After Effects.
â¢ Strong typography & layout skills: In addition to the above, you need to have the ability to create clear, compelling designs that communicate brand messaging effectively.
â¢ Organized: Working on multiple projects at once requires a high level of organization and detail orientation. We work in Hive, a project management tool for collaboration and deliverable management.
â¢ Formal design education: Because this role requires the ability to flex to each clientâs brand voice and users, weâre looking for someone with a formal degree in design (bachelorâs or associate's).

The Impact

Within 1 month, youâll have - 
â¢ Met all key stakeholders and team members that you will be working with
â¢ An understanding of our service offerings
â¢ Reviewed all of our relevant processes to understand how things are currently working 
â¢ A deep knowledge of the Meeting Tomorrow brand
â¢ A full understanding of the Event Production industry and top trends 

In 3 months, youâll have -
â¢ Started building out new templates and processes for the creative process and deliverables 
â¢ Familiarity with the brand guidelines of our top clients
â¢ Begun providing design services to support events in collaboration with the creative team 

In 6 months, youâll have -
â¢ Full anatomy in your role
â¢ Been a part of brainstorming, designing, and pitching 5 winning event designs
â¢ Expanded our vendor network to have new options for clients in all mid-tier and major markets
â¢ Helped improve materials for building out new products and creative service offerings 

Benefits
â¢ Medical, dental, and vision plan options 
â¢ Employer paid STD, LTD, Life Insurance, and EAP access
â¢ 401k with employer matching up to 4%
â¢ 16 PTO days (increases with tenure) + 9 paid holidays
â¢ Annual profit-sharing bonus
â¢ 12 weeks 100% paid parental leave (maternity, paternity, adoption)
â¢ $50 Monthly fitness reimbursement 
â¢ Monthly stipends for internet and/or cell
â¢ Company donation(s) to your charities of choice (up to $1,000 annually)
â¢ Regular social events and learning opportunities

At Meeting Tomorrow, our mission is to foster a culture of respect and affection. We embrace our differences and are committed to having a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment. Weâre an Equal Opportunity Employer that believes in second chances and strongly encourage BIPOC, women, LGBTQIA, veterans, persons with disabilities, formerly incarcerated and all other individuals to apply.


What makes Meeting Tomorrowâs culture so special is the people, and we look for candidates who are a match for our companyâs core values: commitment, kindness and humility. If those words describe you and you see yourself in this posting, youâre ready to apply!
